docs.text: WELCOME TO THE SN0W ＜＞＜ DOCUMENTATION! Above: SN0W ＜＞＜ LOGO What is SN0W ＜＞＜? It's a ＜＞＜ subgroup that serves to guide you to become a ROSE ＜＞＜ member as fast as possible, while also serving as a place for inspiration(and guidance if needed) for creatives that want to make something What does ＜＞＜ mean? It's a symbol associated with the fish community( ＜＞＜ community ), for more information go to the ＜＞＜ community discord server ROADS If you want to know how to get to ROSE ＜＞＜ as fast as possible, go to Road to ROSE If you want to know how to get to CRYSTALL1ZED ＜＞＜ , go to Road to CRYSTALL1ZED If you want to learn World Creation , go to Road to Worlds If you want to learn Avatar Creation , go to Road to Avatars If you want to learn Filmmaking , go to Road to Film SUBMISSIONS To sumbit your own page, go to I wanna submit a page!

docs.text: WELCOME TO THE SN0W ＜＞＜ DOCUMENTATION! WHAT IS THIS? This is a documentation teaches you the overalls of creation, as well as being a guide to ROSE ＜＞＜ and SN0W ＜＞＜ CRYSTALLIZATION . WHO IS THIS FOR? This is for those who want to create, ROSE ＜＞＜ members, those who aim to become a part of ROSE ＜＞＜ , and those who aim to be CRYSTALLIZED . HOW DO I JOIN THE DISCORD SERVER click on this --> SN0W ＜＞＜ Discord Server AND HOW ABOUT THE VRCHAT GROUP? click on that --> SN0W ＜＞＜ VRChat Group HOW CAN I CONTRIBUTE TO THE DOCUMENTATION? You can contribute by submitting your own pages to the documentation HOW CAN I CONTACT THE OWNER? Email: saii@lesaii.com Discord: lesaii (please make sure to message me with "I found you on the documentation" in your first message so I don't mistake you for a scammer) HOW CAN I SUPPORT THE OWNER? There is no way to support lesaii as of now
docs.title: About

docs.title: WELCOME TO THE SN0W ＜＞＜ DOCUMENTATION!

docs.text: So you want to make an avatar, right? aight bet First things first, choose your theme doesn't have to be anything grand, I mean if you've seen cunks_feet's avatars, they're literally chosen on a whim, so yeah just pick one. Second things second, find a base just go on BOOTH and find a base that you like Or alternatively use an Unk (a free avatar base that cunks_feet made himself) by going over to the CHEESE ＜＞＜ discord server and then asking cunks_feet in DAILY VRCHAT for an Unk . Don't worry too much about asking him about this, he won't mind. Above: EXAMPLE PICTURE OF THE UNK AVATAR BASE Third things third, start up Unity via ALCOM or VCC , load up a base into the project and start working on it I believe that improvisation is key when it comes to tackling projects. I mean some planning is of course necessary but we already did that with the previous 2 steps. and yes , that amount of planning is perfectly fine, just something that gets you off the ground and running, that's all you need Of course if you don't know how to install unity and do the bare basics, there are other tutorials and documentations out there! Try the official VRChat documentation , vrc.school , or just finding a tutorial on YouTube Also the documentations above will help you in the journey of making your avatar, so don't forget to check them out if you are struggling with something! Also one bonus thing, if you want to find some cool stuff to add to your avatar, go over to The ＜＞＜ community discord server Above: VISUAL ON THE AVATAR PREFABS CHANNEL IN THE ＜＞＜ COMMUNITY DISCORD SERVER and click on the avatar prefabs channel or alternatively go over to the CHEESE ＜＞＜ discord server Above: VISUAL ON THE AVATAR PREFABS CHANNEL IN THE CHEESE ＜＞＜ DISCORD SERVER and click on the avatar prefabs channel There are lots of cool stuff there ! After you have made and uploaded your avatar, if it's public, share it around with your friends, SNOW ＜＞＜ , and The ＜＞＜ community ! If your avatar is meant to be submitted for CRYSTALL1ZED ＜＞＜ , then head over to the SN0W ＜＞＜ discord server and submit your avatar at the CRYSTALL1ZED contributions channel! Above: VISUAL ON THE LOCATION OF THE CRYSTALL1ZED CONTRIBUTIONS CHANNEL If your avatar is meant to be submitted for ROSE ＜＞＜ , then go over to The ＜＞＜ community Discord Server and submit your avatar at the ROSE FISH contributions channel! Above: VISUAL ON THE LOCATION OF THE ROSE CONTRIBUTIONS CHANNEL This page was written by le Saii
docs.title: Road to avatars

docs.title: So you want to make an avatar, right?

docs.text: ROAD TO CRYSTALL1ZED Above: CRYSTALL1ZED ＜＞＜ LOGO What is SN0W ＜＞＜ CRYSTALL1ZED? CRYSTALL1ZED ＜＞＜ is a content creation community that is an addition to ROSE ＜＞＜ . It serves both as a tutorial for ROSE ＜＞＜ ( CRYSTALL1ZED I ), as well being a sort of DLC after you have joined ROSE ＜＞＜ ( CRYSTALL1ZED II , CRYSTALL1ZED III , CRYSTALL1ZED IV , and CRYSTALL1ZED V ) When someone gets CRYSTALL1ZED they get exclusive access to things like: Participate in votes in upcoming Crystallizations! You can share 3D models, World Prefabs, Avatar Prefabs, Art and Graphics, Videos and Films, Sound Effects and other stuff with everyone on this server Access to the exclusive discord channel made for CRYSTALL1ZED ＜＞＜ members CRYSTALL1ZED Role Invitation to the CRYSTALL1ZED ＜＞＜ Group How do I become CRYSTALL1ZED? To become CRYSTALL1ZED you need to make a contribution in The SN0W ＜＞＜ Discord Server that requires human effort to create. For example: Public VRChat avatar/world Films 3D models Script, Code, Utility, Addon, Tools Shaders Videos/Animations Music, Sound Effects only youtube or google drive links allowed Drawings and more! As long as it's related to ＜＞＜ and requires effort to create. Make your contribution concise and presentable. A good presentation, especially a video, is the best way to win votes. Contributions that contain NSFW content are not allowed. You can submit a contribution every 6 hours How about exact instructions? oki go to the SN0W ＜＞＜ Discord Server Above: VISUAL ON THE LOCATION OF THE CRYSTALL1ZED CONTRIBUTIONS CHANNEL click on contributions Above: OVERVIEW ON THE CRYSTALL1ZED SUBMISSIONS CHANNEL; GUIDE TO POST and submit your contribution (optional) look at the example post for more guidance Is there a difference between contributions for CRYSTALL1ZAT10N and contributions for ROSE ＜＞＜? No, there isn't. both contributions are contributions for the ＜＞＜ community as a whole, so go ham with it! There's levels to this? yes, CRYSTALL1ZED ＜＞＜ has levels, ranging from 1 to 5 CRYSTALL1ZED I means that you have successfully contributed 1 creation for Crystallization CRYSTALL1ZED II means that you contributed 1 creation that took a significant amount of effort to pull off, for Crystallization CRYSTALL1ZED III means that you contributed a creation that has inspired 2 people to create something with definitive proof CRYSTALL1ZED IV means that you have inspired 10 people to pass Crystallization II with definitive proof CRYSTALL1ZED V means that you have contributed 10 CRYSTALLIZED II level creations that have successfully inspired 50 people to pass CRYSTALLIZED II themselves with definitive proof How will votes be decided? After submitting a contribution it will be reviewed by le Saii and decided If a vote is necessary, if so all the CRYSTALL1ZED members will participate in a 2-day long voting process. To receive a CRYSTALL1ZED ＜＞＜ invitation‚ the contribution must receive a YES vote from over 60％ of the voting CRYSTALL1ZED members․ But the criteria on which the vote will be decided upon depends on which level you're going for For CRYSTALL1ZED I , 4 points will be considered for you to be accepted Fun: Is it fun? Presentability: Is the contribution well presented and easy to understand? Effort: How much human effort was needed to make this? How much did AI help? Collaboration: How many people were involved in creating the contribution? For CRYSTALL1ZED II , 6 points will be considered for you to be accepted(same criteria as ROSE ＜＞＜ ) Fun: Is it fun? Presentability: Is the contribution well presented and easy to understand? Effort: How much human effort was needed to make this? How much did AI help? Usability: Can it be used for something? Originality: How different is the contribution from previous contributions? Collaboration: How many people were involved in creating the contribution? For CRYSTALL1ZED III , only 2 points will be considered Inspiration: Has your creation inspired 2 people? Creation: Have those who were inspired by you, created anything? For CRYSTALL1ZED IV , only 2 points will be considered as well, but on a much higher level Inspiration Has your creation inspired 10 people? Creation Have those 10 people made and contributed enough to be CRYSTALL1ZED II ? CRYSTALL1ZED V , is split into 2 requirements, and those have separate criteria Requirement 1: Make 10 creations that satisfy CRYSTALL1ZED II requirements Requirement 2: Those 10 creations have successfully made 50 people make and contribute enough to be CRYSTALL1ZED II ? not gonna lie, I don't know what I want to make no worries! just go to one of these paths to figure out what you wanna make, then you can submit your contribution to CRYSTALL1ZED ＜＞＜ when you're ready Road to Worlds(World Creation) Road to Avatars(Avatar Creation) Road to Film(Filmmaking) This page was written by le Saii
docs.title: ROAD TO CRYSTALL1ZED

docs.text: So you want to learn filmmaking! You're my fren now, let's eat soft tacos later! Being silly aside though The Filmmaking process is split into Three phases, The Pre-Production phase, Production , and Post-Production phases Don't worry about those complicated seeming words though, it's actually much simpler than you might think The Pre-Production phase This phase is about making a plan or a script for your film! It probably sounds hard but if you really think about it, for a simple film all you really need is a little plan It can be as simple as Introduction(preferably visual) Conflict Resolution You can also play around with those 3 steps, like repeating them and chaining them together, like after the resolution another conflict arises, similar to how when you fix a bug, 10 more bugs appear in your game :p There are various things you can play around with in the pre-production phase of the film, but it's mainly just writing, and if you really want to be thourough about it, then try storyboarding. (optional) Storyboarding really involves you already knowing how to do visuals with your camera, so if you're new don't even think too much about this one, move onto the next point but for those who already have made a film or 2, then take those visuals you have in your head and make a simple stick figure or a shape, signifying the shot/scene for you don't forget to put descriptions for the scene, cause you might need to explain your storyboarding to others, if you're gonna work with others. Now time for the Production Phase! The production phase is split into 4 parts: Picking Worlds Preparing your shots Planning out film sessions(if the scene requires more than 1 person) Executing them Picking Worlds This is pretty straightforward, with the things you have planned, just find a world that fits the criteria of the scenes you wanna shoot, or make your own world Prepare your shots This one requires you to know the basics of cinematography, but the main thing you gotta know is that the VRChat camera grid(the option on the veeeery right of the VRChat camera) is your best friend However if you wanna be a little bit more thorough, then try looking into the shot sizes and camera movement types in film Plan out your Film Sessions If your film is really short and requires a really small amount of shots with people, then go to publics and/or your friends and ask them in your film session(best if you remind them an hour before though) But if it requires more than 2 shots, then follow these 3 steps Plan it out. Plan your film sessions for Late Friday and Late Saturday EST. (optional) Make a discord server or a group chat. Find people. Go to publics and/or your friends and ask them to be in your film session, tell them when, and if you have done point 2, then invite them to your discord/group chat with the message on when the film session is, posted in there. Execute the Film Session Now that everything is planned out, when the film session starts, load up OBS , invite your people, and start the film session! also a little tip, if you asked your friends, see if you can get them to record their voicelines in audacity while they are in the film session. It could help you get better control of your audio during post-production. if you won't do that and your film needs voice lines, you will need to find people to record some voice lines for you. Post-Production Phase Here you gather up all your shots, go over to Davinci Resolve , CapCut or Kdenlive and Start Editing your Film! I recommend using Davinci Resolve as it has all of the tools you need for Post-Production in Film! Post-Production is split into 5 parts Selection of shots Editing Sound design VFX and Subtitling Selection of Shots This is pretty straightforward, just look over to the shots that you've filmed and pick the ones that fit the most with your film and feel the best. Editing Editing is the act of putting the clips together, so everything would feel seamless and the pacing would be perfect(to you of course) In editing make sure to follow your gut, as well as the audio waveform if you already picked a soundtrack or you already have voice clips Sound Design Sound Design is the act of gathering sfx, music and voice clips and making the best thing you can out of those three You can use Davinci Resolve for it, or go to a DAW(like Reaper) to use external tools, plugins and VST's to achieve the best thing you can with sound Sound Design is so cool...ahem VFX VFX is the act of making cool effects happen on your screen to enhance the film you're watching, VFX can include stuff like portals, fireballs or simple visuals like VHS style effects and the like. You can look up some cool VFX tutorials on YouTube but I recommend looking at channels like Subtitling This is the last thing you will do in a film, it's basically the transcribing what the characters say on screen and/or putting text in the film. After you're done with pre-production, production and post-production, you are ready to publish your film! Make sure to title it as something and share it around with your friends, SN0W ＜＞＜ and The ＜＞＜ community ! If your film is meant to be submitted for CRYSTALL1ZED ＜＞＜ , then head over to The SN0W ＜＞＜ Discord Server and submit your film at the CRYSTALL1ZED contributions channel! Above: VISUAL ON THE LOCATION OF THE CRYSTALL1ZED CONTRIBUTIONS CHANNEL If your film is meant to be submitted for ROSE ＜＞＜ , then go over to The ＜＞＜ community Discord Server and submit your film at the ROSE FISH contributions channel! Above: VISUAL ON THE LOCATION OF THE ROSE CONTRIBUTIONS CHANNEL This page was written by le Saii
docs.title: So you want to learn filmmaking!

docs.title: Post-Production Phase

docs.text: ROAD TO ROSE Above: SPINNING ROSE ＜＞＜ OFFICIAL NOTES ROSE ＜＞＜ is a content creation community that makes content for the ＜＞＜ community․ When someone joins ROSE ＜＞＜, they get access to exclusive things like: Participate in votes for upcoming ROSE ＜＞＜ members at a dedicated ROSE ＜＞＜ submission channel for future ROSE ＜＞＜ members Name placement on the SIGNIFICANT CONTRIBUTIONS boards in VRChat worlds Your projects will appear in the ROSE ＜＞＜ database You can share 3D models, Art Graphics, Sound effects and other stuff with everyone on this server. Avatars more promoted at the ＜＞＜ AVATARS world Access to the exclusive discord channels made for ROSE ＜＞＜ members An exclusive ROSE ＜＞＜ discord role Invitation to the ROSE ＜＞＜ VRChat group QUALIFICATIONS To join ROSE ＜＞＜ you need to make a contribution that requires human effort to create and could be easily used by the fish community members. For example: Public VRChat avatar/world Films 3D models Script, Code, Utility, Addon, Tools Shaders Videos/Animations Music, Sound Effects only youtube or google drive links allowed Drawings and more! As long as it's related to ＜＞＜ and requires effort to create. Make your contribution concise and presentable. A good presentation, especially a video, is the best way to win votes. Contributions that contain NSFW content are not allowed. After submitting a contribution it will be reviewed by TheZiver and decided If a vote is necessary, if so all the rose fish members will participate in a 2-day long voting process. To receive a rose fish invitation‚ the contribution must receive a YES vote from over 60％ of the voting rose fish members․ Deciding if a vote is necessary TheZiver will consider these things: Fun: Is it fun? Presentability: Is the contribution well presented and easy to understand? Effort: How much human effort was needed to make this? How much did AI help? Usability: Can it be used for something? Originality: How different is the contribution from previous contributions? Collaboration: How many people were involved in creating the contribution? HOW TO JOIN ROSE ＜＞＜ To join ROSE ＜＞＜ you need to make a contribution that requires human effort to create and could be easily used by the fish community members. That means that you have to make something to join it, but what can you make? For now we got 3 paths we can offer in the creation process for ROSE ＜＞＜: Road to Worlds(World Creation) Road to Avatars(Avatar Creation) Road to Film(Filmmaking) This page was written by le Saii
docs.title: ROAD TO ROSE

docs.text: So we're making a world aight bet First things first, Load up a Unity Project via ALCOM or VCC and Install the Pro Builder plugin unlike with avatars, for worlds, NO PLANNING WHATSOEVER IS NEEDED Because we are in the Prototyping Stage! Also because we are in the Prototyping Stage, if your plan for your world is for it to be a game world, then I recommend making a simple prototype/sketch of what will be the gameplay in your game world(remember, keep it simple). So If you don't know jack shit about first time setup then go over to The Official VRChat Documentation , vrc.school , or find a YouTube tutorial to help you out with that (please don't fall into the tutorial hell before you even get started...please) After you're done making your sketch It's time for the Modeling Stage You could choose one of the 3 options from now on: continue building with ProBuilder using external assets for your project or build the models for your world in Blender If you want a little push when it comes to modeling, there's a more in depth tutorial for pro-builder For external assets you can go to booth , the Unity Asset Store , or the 3d models channel in The＜＞＜ community Discord Server , get some models and drag and drop them into your unity project As for blender...god bless you Next up, we have the Texturing Stage to be honest it's very much tied to the Modeling Stage, but I want to give it a separate stage For Texturing I recommend using GIMP , or Affinity I recommend playing around with textures and the photo editing software as it can be fun to play around in it(so much so that you'll lose track of time lmao) But keep in mind your original idea for a texture(or you'll get off track) Next up we have the Programming Stage Here you are split between 2 paths, the Path of Udon Graph , or the Path of UdonSharp The difference is literally about if you prefer visual programming or traditional programming Though the differences also are about support, what I mean is Udon Graph from my experience has a little bit less support, due to the simple fact that developers nowadays work with AI when it comes to programming, and it's much harder to work with code if it is visual over textual. So if you're planning to use the assistance of ChatGPT or Claude, It's a better idea to go for UdonSharp Though I personally think that it's always a good idea to know how your code works exactly or close to exactly even if you're coding with the assistance of AI So please, make sure to check documentations, look at blogs, look at discord servers for solutions and always ask your AI, how does the code work? I promise this will take you leaps and bounds further compared to if you didn't do that. As for what you can make in the world when it comes to programming, for starters, how about a toggleable mirror? Now once you're done with programming you can move onto the optional stage of world dev! (optional) "Adding the cool stuff you like into your world" Stage! you can do so by searching around booth , or any other marketplace orrr by going over to The ＜＞＜ community Discord Server Above: VISUAL ON THE WORLD PREFABS CHANNEL clicking on the world prefabs channel, downloading some cool stuff the ＜＞＜ community has made, and dropping them into your world! Now, once you've done with programming and adding the things you want into your world, we're gonna move onto the Testing and Optimizing Stage In this stage make sure to test everything thoroughly, and under 10x the conditions to make sure that your world doesn't lag on older hardware or phones. For example let's say you have an enemy AI in your world with a complicated script for it. Try spawning a 1000 or 2000 of them into your world(this is an over exaggeration but you can do this to test extreme situations), if your world lags then see how you can optimize your code or the world itself A couple things you can do in your world is Turn all of the objects that you know wont move, static Enable Occlusion Culling Reduce the size of your textures(the default is 2048), if you want your texture to be pixelated over being blurry like a youtube video, then change the filter mode from Bilinear to Point(no filter) And lastly, the Lightning Stage! There are 2 routes that you can take with the Lighting Stage: The Bakery Route , or the Unity Lighting System Route The Lighting Route doesn't take too long to finish as you need to only configure a couple stuff then let your pc bake the lights. Though it will take longer if you're particular about the kind of lighting you want to have. And with that You are finished with the world! Just upload your world and see how it looks! if it looks good, publish it to community labs and share it around with your friends, SNOW ＜＞＜ , and The ＜＞＜ community ! If your world is meant to be submitted for CRYSTALL1ZED ＜＞＜ , then head over to the SN0W ＜＞＜ discord server and submit your world at the CRYSTALL1ZED contributions channel! Above: VISUAL ON THE LOCATION OF THE CRYSTALL1ZED CONTRIBUTIONS CHANNEL If your world is meant to be submitted for ROSE ＜＞＜ , then go over to The ＜＞＜ community Discord Server and submit your world at the ROSE FISH contributions channel! Above: VISUAL ON THE LOCATION OF THE ROSE CONTRIBUTIONS CHANNEL This page was written by le Saii
docs.title: So we're making a world

docs.title: Lightning Stage!

docs.text: You wanna submit a page? bet So go over to the SN0W ＜＞＜ discord server Above: VISUAL ON THE SUBMISSIONS CHANNEL and click on the page submissions channel. Above: OVERVIEW ON THE SUBMISSIONS CHANNEL; GUIDE TO POST Here you can create your post! Just write your post name on the top and don't forget to include your TXT or MD files in your post! Also if you want you can check the example post for a little guide on how you could format your own post. Happy Writing!
docs.title: Submit

docs.text: bet So go over to the SN0W ＜＞＜ discord server Above: VISUAL ON THE SUBMISSIONS CHANNEL and click on the page submissions channel. Above: OVERVIEW ON THE SUBMISSIONS CHANNEL; GUIDE TO POST Here you can create your post! Just write your post name on the top and don't forget to include your TXT or MD files in your post! Also if you want you can check the example post for a little guide on how you could format your own post. Happy Writing!
